newsitem.title: CHINA: Haier Refrigerator to offer 110 million B shares.
newsitem.headline: Haier Refrigerator to offer 110 million B shares.

text.p: Qingdao Haier Refrigerator Co plans to make an offer of 110 million B shares and list the stock in Shanghai, a company spokesman said on Thursday.
The company, based in the coastal city of Qingdao in Shangdong province, is among 33 companies newly selected by the Securities Commission of the State Council as candidates for B share listings.
China Southern Securities has been appointed the lead underwriter for the offer, while an international coordinator has yet to be selected, the official said.
Haier will use the proceeds from the offer to improve its refrigerator processing technology and diversify its business to produce washing machines and microwave ovens, the official said.
Haier, one of China's biggest refrigerator makers, has about 20 percent of the domestic market with output of 1.6 million units in 1996, up 60 percent from one million in 1995, he said.
He expects the company's output in 1997 to be 1.8 million refrigerators.
Haier posted after-tax profits of 88.74 million yuan in the first half of 1996, compared with 57.81 million yuan in the year-earlier period.
Its 1995 net profits under Chinese accounting standards were 117.31 million yuan, up 21.7 percent from 96.40 million yuan in 1994.
Haier has a total of 272.11 million shares, comprising 172.13 million institutional shares and 99.98 million A shares listed in Shanghai.
